_comment: Australia and New Zealand compliance norms and standards database. Includes RCM, ACMA, AS/NZS standards, GEMS, TGA and other regulatory requirements. Updated for 2025 compliance requirements.

norms.name: Regulatory Compliance Mark
norms.applies_to: Electrical equipment, EMC equipment, telecommunications equipment
norms.description: Unified compliance mark replacing C-Tick (EMC) and A-Tick (telecommunications). Mandatory for prescribed electrical equipment. Indicates compliance with electrical safety, EMC, and telecommunications requirements. Supplier Declaration of Conformity required.

norms.name: Essential Safety Requirements for Electrical Equipment
norms.description: Defines essential safety requirements for electrical equipment in Australia and New Zealand. Foundation standard for electrical safety compliance. Risk-based approach.

norms.name: Audio/Video, ICT and Communication Technology Equipment - Safety
norms.applies_to: IT equipment, AV equipment, communication equipment
norms.description: Australia/New Zealand adoption of IEC 62368-1. Hazard-based safety standard for ICT equipment. Required for RCM compliance for ICT products.

norms.name: Information Technology Equipment - Safety (LEGACY)
norms.description: LEGACY standard for IT equipment safety. Withdrawn and replaced by AS/NZS 62368.1. May still be referenced in older certifications until transition period ends.

norms.name: Information Technology Equipment - Radio Disturbance Characteristics
norms.description: EMC emission requirements for IT equipment. Class A (commercial) and Class B (residential) limits. Required for RCM compliance.

norms.name: Multimedia Equipment - EMC Requirements - Emission
norms.description: Emission requirements for multimedia equipment. Replaces AS/NZS CISPR 22 for newer equipment. Required for RCM.

norms.name: Multimedia Equipment - EMC Requirements - Immunity
norms.description: Immunity requirements for multimedia equipment. Works with CISPR 32 for complete EMC compliance.

norms.name: Mobile Phones - RF Exposure - Maximum SAR
norms.applies_to: Mobile phones and handheld radio devices
norms.description: SAR (Specific Absorption Rate) limits for mobile phones. 2.0 W/kg averaged over 10g of tissue. Required for ACMA approval.

norms.name: Radio Equipment Compliance Framework
norms.description: Framework for radio equipment compliance. Supplier Declaration of Conformity required. RCM mark mandatory. Covers WiFi, Bluetooth, cellular, all radio equipment.

norms.name: Radio Frequency Exposure - Human Exposure to EMF
norms.description: Limits for human exposure to radio frequency electromagnetic fields. 3 kHz to 300 GHz. Required for devices with RF transmission above specified power levels.

norms.name: Performance Criteria - RF Transmitters 9kHz to 400GHz
norms.description: Performance criteria for radio frequency transmitters. Technical requirements for ACMA compliance. Covers frequency stability, spurious emissions, power limits.

norms.name: Household Appliances - Safety - General Requirements
norms.description: General safety requirements for household appliances. Harmonized with IEC 60335-1. Part 1 of comprehensive series. Required for RCM compliance of appliances.

norms.name: Household Appliances - Safety - Particular Requirements
norms.description: Part 2 series with specific requirements for different appliances. Over 100 parts covering specific products (vacuum cleaners, coffee makers, heaters, etc.).

norms.name: Approval and Test Specification - General Requirements for Electrical Equipment
norms.description: General requirements for electrical equipment approval. Covers construction, testing, marking requirements. Foundation standard for many product categories.

norms.name: Automatic Circuit Reclosers
norms.applies_to: Automatic circuit breakers and protection devices
norms.description: Requirements for automatic circuit reclosers for distribution systems. Relevant for power protection devices.

norms.name: Safety of Power Transformers - General Requirements
norms.description: Safety requirements for power transformers and similar equipment. Includes AC-DC adapters, power supplies. Required for RCM.

norms.name: Safety of Transformers - Particular Requirements for Safety Isolating Transformers
norms.description: Specific requirements for safety isolating transformers. Used in power supplies for portable equipment.

norms.name: Secondary Cells and Batteries - Portable Lithium Batteries
norms.description: Safety requirements for portable lithium secondary cells and batteries. Required for battery compliance. Harmonized with IEC 62133-2.

norms.name: Determination of Certain Substances in Electrotechnical Products
norms.description: Test methods for determination of regulated substances (lead, mercury, cadmium, hexavalent chromium, PBBs, PBDEs, phthalates). Used for voluntary RoHS-like compliance.

norms.name: Greenhouse and Energy Minimum Standards - Product Registration
norms.applies_to: GEMS regulated products including appliances, lighting, electronics
norms.description: Mandatory energy efficiency and labeling requirements. Products must be registered in GEMS database before supply. Includes minimum energy performance standards (MEPS) and energy rating labels.

norms.name: Minimum Energy Performance Standards
norms.description: Mandatory minimum energy efficiency levels. Products must meet MEPS to be sold. Covers 30+ product categories including computers, TVs, refrigerators, air conditioners.

norms.name: Energy Rating Label (Stars System)
norms.applies_to: Appliances and equipment with energy rating requirements
norms.description: Mandatory energy rating label showing star rating (1-10 stars) and energy consumption. Required for appliances like fridges, air conditioners, TVs, computers.

norms.name: Therapeutic Goods Administration - Medical Device Regulation
norms.description: Medical device regulation by TGA. Classification I-III, IIa, IIb based on risk. Conformity assessment required. Pre-market approval or listing on Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods (ARTG).

norms.name: Medical Devices - Quality Management Systems
norms.description: Quality management system requirements for medical device manufacturers. Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO 13485. Required for TGA compliance.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Risk Management
norms.description: Risk management requirements for medical devices. Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO 14971. Required for TGA compliance.

norms.name: Consumer Protection and Product Safety
norms.description: Comprehensive consumer protection law. Consumer guarantees, product safety obligations, recall requirements, misleading conduct prohibitions. Enforced by ACCC.

norms.name: Mandatory Product Safety Standards
norms.description: Mandatory safety standards for specific products (toys, prams, baby walkers, flotation devices, bunk beds, etc.). Compliance mandatory before supply. Enforced by ACCC.

norms.name: Safety of Toys
norms.description: Comprehensive toy safety standard. Covers mechanical/physical properties, flammability, migration of elements. Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO 8124. Referenced in mandatory standards.

norms.id: Competition and Consumer (Consumer Goods Safety Standard) (Toys for Children up to and including 36 Months of Age) 2023
norms.name: Mandatory Toy Safety Standard
norms.applies_to: Toys for children 36 months and under
norms.description: Mandatory safety requirements for toys for young children. References AS/NZS ISO 8124. Small parts, choking hazards, toxic substances. ACCC enforced.

norms.name: Safety Requirements for Toys
norms.description: Australian/New Zealand toy safety standard. Comprehensive safety requirements. Used with ISO 8124 for complete compliance.

norms.name: Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act
norms.description: Federal environmental protection law. Protects matters of national environmental significance. Affects product design, materials, end-of-life. Administered by Department of Climate Change, Energy, Environment.

norms.id: National Television and Computer Recycling Scheme
norms.name: E-Waste Recycling Obligations
norms.description: Product stewardship scheme for e-waste. Importers and manufacturers fund recycling. Covers TVs, computers, printers, keyboards, mice. Free collection for consumers.

norms.name: Collection, Storage, Transport and Treatment of E-waste
norms.description: Requirements for e-waste collection, storage, transport, treatment. Ensures environmentally sound management. Relevant for product take-back programs.

norms.name: Environmental Management Systems
norms.description: Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO 14001. Environmental management system requirements. Voluntary but widely adopted.

norms.name: Australian Packaging Covenant (APCO)
norms.applies_to: Companies importing or manufacturing packaged goods
norms.description: Industry-government voluntary initiative for sustainable packaging. Members commit to sustainable packaging practices. Reporting requirements. Increasing importance for market access.

norms.name: Product Packaging - Biodegradable Plastics Suitable for Composting
norms.description: Requirements for compostable plastics. Biodegradability, compostability testing. Used for sustainable packaging claims.

norms.name: Work Health and Safety Regulations
norms.description: Workplace health and safety requirements. Affects industrial equipment, machinery, hazardous substances. Harmonized across Australian states/territories. Administered by Safe Work Australia.

norms.name: Safety of Machinery
norms.description: Series of standards for machinery safety. Covers design, safeguarding, risk assessment. Australia/New Zealand approach to machinery safety.

norms.name: Safety of Machinery - Electrical Equipment
norms.description: Electrical safety requirements for machinery. Harmonized with IEC 60204-1. Required for industrial equipment.

norms.name: Electrical Installations (Wiring Rules)
norms.description: Electrical installation requirements. Australian/New Zealand wiring rules. Affects fixed electrical equipment, building installations. Not directly for product compliance but important for installed equipment.

norms.name: In-Service Safety Inspection and Testing of Electrical Equipment
norms.description: Requirements for testing and tagging of portable electrical equipment. Required in workplaces. Affects portable appliances, tools, extension cords.

norms.name: National Construction Code
norms.description: Building standards for construction in Australia. Affects electrical equipment, fire safety equipment, plumbing products for building installation. State-based adoption.

norms.name: Planning for Emergencies in Facilities
norms.description: Requirements for emergency planning. Affects emergency lighting, alarm systems, safety equipment. Relevant for buildings and facilities.

norms.name: Quality Management Systems
norms.description: Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO 9001. Quality management system requirements. Voluntary but widely recognized. JAS-ANZ accredits certification bodies.

norms.name: Information Security Management Systems
norms.description: Australia/New Zealand adoption of ISO/IEC 27001. Information security management requirements. Increasingly important for connected products.

norms.name: Privacy and Data Protection
norms.description: Australian privacy law. 13 Australian Privacy Principles (APPs). Applies to personal information handling. Relevant for connected devices, software, services. Enforced by OAIC.

norms.name: IT Security Evaluation (Common Criteria)
norms.description: Australia/New Zealand adoption of Common Criteria. Framework for IT security evaluation. Used for government procurement, high-security products.

norms.name: Essential Eight and ISM
norms.description: Cybersecurity guidelines including Essential Eight mitigation strategies and Information Security Manual (ISM). Relevant for products used in government and critical infrastructure.

norms.name: Trademark and False Origin Marking
norms.description: Protects trademarks and prohibits false origin markings. Affects product labeling, country of origin claims. Enforced by IP Australia and ACCC.

norms.name: Country of Origin Food Labelling Information Standard
norms.applies_to: Food products and some non-food consumer goods
norms.description: Mandatory country of origin labeling for food. Voluntary for other products but consumer expectation. Kangaroo logo, bar chart, text requirements.
